title: Costume dresses from the True History of the Kelly Gang
brief_description: Crafted from used vintage fabrics and sourced from markets, the individualised dresses in True History of the Kelly Gang are likened to warpaint to scare the enemy by the film’s characters, but they also speak to their inner selves.

constellations_primary.name: Pink, Pose, punk, Pilgrim
constellations_primary.description: Alice Babidge's costume design for True History of the Kelly Gang sees the iconic foursome and their accomplices in dresses, a gender-expansive stance that connects to other rebellious outlooks on the world.

title_for_label: True History of the Kelly Gang costume dresses
headline_credit_for_label:
True HIstory of the Kelly Gang, Australia, 2020

Designed by Alice Babidge
description: Like the individualised armour in True History of the Kelly Gang, the dresses the outlaw Kelly Gang wear speak to their character’s inner selves. While the characters liken the dresses to a kind of warpaint to scare the enemy, costume designer Alice Babidge explained that “this was about finding a way for men or boys to wear dresses that didn’t feel camp – that felt strong or beautiful”. Bushranger Steve Hart’s (Louis Hewison) costumes draw the link between the armour and dresses, with both featuring a flower motif. To craft the dresses, Babidge used second-hand vintage fabrics, often sourced from markets.
description_for_label: Like the individualised armour in True History of the Kelly Gang, the dresses the outlaw Kelly Gang wear speak to their character’s inner selves. Bushranger Steve Hart’s (Louis Hewison) costumes draw the link between the armour and dresses, with both featuring a flower motif. To craft the dresses, Babidge used second-hand vintage fabrics, often sourced from markets.
